What are the current limitations and disclaimers associated with using Verus Desktop for creating PBaaS chains, and what are the terms of the software license?

When using Verus Desktop to create PBaaS chains, there are some limitations and disclaimers to be aware of. Currently, if a currency is already supported in Verus Desktop, such as Bitcoin (BTC) or Ethereum (ETH), you will not be able to use those same currency names as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata and will be resolved before mainnet availability.

It's also important to note that the software is experimental and unfinished, and use of it is at your own risk. There is no warranty for any kind of damage that may occur.

Regarding the software license, it is provided under an open-source license that allows anyone to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and sell copies of the software. This license also permits persons to whom the software is furnished to do so. The only conditions are that the enclosed copyright notice and this permission notice must be included in all copies or substantial portions of the software.

The software is provided "as is", without warranty of any kind, express or implied, including but not limited to the warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement. In no event shall the authors or copyright holders be liable for any claim, damages, or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort, or otherwise, arising from, out of, or in connection with the software or the use or other dealings in the software.
